Articles.Content:
I modified my Kerbal Personnel Transport Ship by replacing the 4 LV-909's with just 2 LV-N's.

As long as I'm not landing on a large planet the lander should be able to take-off without problems.

I also removed one of the 2 single seat rovers attached to the sides and modified the remaining rover by making it a 3 seater.

It's light enough that it doesn't throw off the ship's CoM and no one gets left behind.

Aerobraking over Duna...

The obligatory planting of the flag...

Take-off was a bit slow. Almost too slow for comfort. If it was any slower I doubt they would have made it to orbit...

After re-docking with the transfer stage and refueled the lander they stopped at Ike an planted a flag there as well...

Returning to Kerbin...

Re-entry and the traditional popping of the corn... Smores too...

Safe at Home... Now If they could just get a ride back to command...

Too bad the rover can't reattach to the lander. It had to be left back on Duna. I'll need to rethink the design. Removing that 2nd rover was perhaps not the best idea.
